thread.title: Daily Fantasy Football: Andy Dalton and Adrian Peterson are must starts in FanDuel during Week 6
thread.title_full: Daily Fantasy Football: Andy Dalton and Adrian Peterson are must starts in FanDuel during Week 6

title: Daily Fantasy Football: Andy Dalton and Adrian Peterson are must starts in FanDuel during Week 6
text:
By Neil Greenberg October 14 at 1:09 PM Follow @ngreenberg Cincinnati Bengals quarterback Andy Dalton ranks second in ESPN’s Total Quarterback Rating and is second in yards gained on passes targeted 20 or more yards downfield. (AP Photo/Patrick Semansky) 
If you’ve been keeping up with the recent news surrounding daily fantasy sports , you’ll know the sharks are swimming. And while that may dull the interest for some casual users, it only reinforces the fact that information is the key to winning. 
However, those of us without access to player ownership rates and salaries prior to the contests need to be smart in constructing our lineups by using the best available data to us. 
The advice you’ll find here is generated using point spreads and over/under lines to maximize the number of points scored by the recommended lineup each week. 
Here is a lineup for Week 6 that I believe will help give you an edge. 
Quarterback: Andy Dalton, Cincinnati Bengals 
Andy Dalton ranks second in ESPN’s Total Quarterback Rating and is second in yards gained on passes targeted 20 or more yards downfield . 
Running back: Adrian Peterson, Minnesota Vikings 
Peterson has topped 15 FanDuel points in three of four weeks and should be able to play with a lead against a Kansas City Chiefs squad that lost Jamaal Charles. 
Running back: Danny Woodhead, San Diego Chargers 
Melvin Gordon is getting more carries, but Woodhead is the goal-line option. 
Wide receiver: Julian Edelman, New England Patriots 
Edelman has seen 10 or more targets in three of his four weeks, and Tom Brady has a 121.6 passer rating on throws to him. 
Wide receiver: T.Y. Hilton, Indianapolis Colts 
Hilton had seven catches on 13 targets for 67 yards on Sunday and faces the Patriots, who are in the top 10 for FanDuel points allowed to the position (30.6). 
Wide receiver: Jordan Matthews, Philadelphia Eagles 
Only Larry Fitzgerald (3.09) and Doug Baldwin (2.01) have averaged more yards per route run from the slot than Matthews (1.94). 
Tight end: Martellus Bennett, Chicago Bears 
The Lions’ defense has allowed the sixth-most points to tight ends (11.7 per game). 
Defense: New York Jets 
Cornerback Darelle Revis has allowed a 23.8 passer rating against and has two interceptions. His opposing quarterback this week, the Redskins’ Kirk Cousins, has six interceptions in five games. 
Kicker: Travis Coons, Cleveland Browns 
The Browns have the second lowest red-zone touchdown scoring percentage, which means a lot of work for Coons on Sunday. Neil Greenberg analyzes advanced sports statistics for the Fancy Stats blog and prefers to be called a geek rather than a nerd. sports Success! Check your inbox for details.
